result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gabrielle P. Kiggins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Minutes Filed
Minutes Filed

Defendant Gabrielle P. Kiggins in court with attorney Kenneth Kratz.  Frederick Ian Bourg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This hearing covers Bayfield County cases 14CM127, 15CF102, 15CF103, 15CF104, 15CF105, 15CF106, 15CF109 and 15CF109.
Kratz; offer has been made, but has been told today there are new allegations; asks for adj. for all cases to be heard.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Gabrielle P. Kiggins
Current: 28540 Marengo Lake Road, Mason, WI 54856 United States  (Effective: 07-26-2016)
Prior: 23170  Camp 8 Road, Grandview, WI 54839
Defendant.  Resent to address on traffic violations
Hearing on August 16, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Minutes Filed
Brief in response to defendants motion to suppress statements
Motion for leave to file state's brief in opposition to defendant's motion to suppress

This Motion Hearing covers Bayfield County cases 14CM127, 15CF102, 15CF103, 15CF104, 15CF105, 15CF106, 15CF108 and 15CF109.  Defendant Gabrielle P. Kiggins in court with attorney Kenneth Kratz.  Frederick Ian Bourg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Continued MH; DA calls witness Brent Bratley; Witness sworn by the Clerk; DA continues cross; 1 week prior to 08-18-2015 rec'd call from jail staff indicating Ms. Kiggins wanted to speak with him; met with her at the interview room in the jail; not recorded conversation; her information did not have anything to do with activity in Bayfield County; no info shared involved her cases in Bayfield Co; shared info with special investigator and he interviewed her 08-18-2015.  Cross by Kratz; 06-04-2015 taken into custody; spoke with her on 06-05-2015 re Bayfield Co activity.  Re-direct by DA; 06-05-2015 interview took place in the interview room and was recorded; was given miranda rights.  Kratz no re-cross.
Edward McKillip sworn and questioned by DA; special agent rec'd info from investigator Bratley and went with special agent to interview Ms. Kiggins; interview took place at the jail in the interview room; the interview was recorded by special agent; audio/visual system in the room, audio not working, visual recording maintained; miranda rights was completed; questioned Ms. Kiggins during the interview; she indicated she understood her rights and wanted to continue with conversation; she did not mention she had an attorney, she was freely and voluntarily answering questions; interview lasted 45 min to an hour; no breaks requested; she agreed to do a ride-along w/ investigator; during the ride-along, she asked DA be called and during that tele call the investigators learned she had an attorney, she was returned to the jail; no further interviews happened with Ms. Kiggins.  Cross by Atty Kratz; 08-18-2015 interview was recorded only for the portion with special agent; BC investigators wanted to discuss burglary issues in BC with her; did not ask her if she was represented by counsel; she did not tell the investigators know she was represented; DA had informed investigators she had an attorney, she was returned to the jail as advised by DA; did not re-initiate interview because investigators were waiting for a return call from her attorney; special agent was present during BC investigator's interview; she was informed at the beginning of the interview that she could stop the interview at any time.  Re-direct by DA; thought the audio/visual system in the interview room was working at the start of the interview; 30-45 min of the interview was for special agent's questions, 15-30 min for BC investigator; would have stopped the interview if knew she had an attorney.  
Gabrielle Kiggins sworn and questioned by Atty Kratz; understands she does not have to testify today; before 08-18-2015 was represented by Atty Kratz; understood she did not have to talk with police; was under the impression that when she was interviewed by BC investigator and special agent had been pre-arranged as part of the de-briefing; believed there were 2 different interviews where the investigators switched and issues questioned were different with each of the investigators; believe Atty Kratz name was mentioned during the interview; describes 08-19-2015 conversation with BC investigators; did not receive any legal advise on Aug. 18 or 19, 2015 from an attorney; only talked with officers to get something in return, better consideration on cases.  Cross by DA; 23 years old at time of interview; remembers she was given miranda warning from officers, previous miranda warnings had been given for previous cases; answers given to special agent and BC investigators were truthful; felt the officers did not care if she had an attorney or not and changed mind on how the ride-along would go; interview on 08-18-2015 was about an hour; no breaks were taken for food or bathroom; did not feel threatened, was trying to help herself; understood the miranda warning that she signed.  No re-direct.  No rebuttal witnesses.
Argument by DA; recites Supreme Court ruling re: miranda warning; clear distinction of ethics requirements in the Kyles case; LE did the right thing by contacting DA and terminating interview; Ms. Kiggins' rights were not violated; based on the factor that there were two questioners in the interview, short in time interview, she was acquainted with miranda warning, waiving rights were K&V, she was trying to help the officers and to help herself, rights were not violated; asks the Court deny defense motion.  
Argument by Atty Kratz; concessions rec'd re: statements made to jail staff and during the 06-2015 interview; there were 2 separate interviews on 08-18-2015, only one miranda warning given; statements affected by the motion are those statements given to investigator McKillip re: the burglary activities; she indicated in her testimony she believed the interview was part of the de-brief, she was expecting consideration for her statements, she denied her involvment in the activity; fresh miranda warning is required at the point of the second interviewer beginning his questions, this is a 5th amendment right issue up to the point of the second interview; asks the Court find her statements were not given freely and voluntarily, asks the unrecorded portion of the interview be suppressed.
DA comments/responds; no tricks or deception on the part of the officers; she has experience with miranda; she knew what she was doing and felt she was in control; no case law that supports second miranda warning is needed, no break taken.  Asks Atty Kratz recite specific statements his motion covers.  Atty Kratz indicates suppress statements during the unrecorded interview.
Court, asks parties file briefs on the issue of a second miranda required, briefs filed by 06-03-2016 by 4 p.m. (faxed or mailed), responses by 06-17-2016 by 4 p.m.  Court orders bond to continue.  Hearing scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance for witness to appear and give evidence on May 10, 2016 at 3:00 p.m. issued to E.M.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance for witness to appear and give evidence on May 10, 2016 at 3:00 p.m. issued to B.B.
